content.question: Which of the following examples is beamed correctly?

choices.label: Two measures of rhythms in four-four time. Measure one is a dotted eighth and sixteenth note beamed together, three eighth notes beamed together, and four sixteenth notes and one eighth note beamed together. Measure two is a dotted quarter note, eighth note, two eighth notes beamed together, and a quarter note.

Two measures of rhythms in four-four time. Measure one is a dotted eighth note, sixteenth note, and eighth note beamed together, two eighth notes beamed together, and four sixteenth notes and one eighth note beamed together. Measure two is a dotted quarter note, three eighth notes beamed together, and a quarter note.

Two measures of rhythms in four-four time. Measure one is a dotted eighth note, sixteenth note, and an eighth note beamed together, two eighth notes and two sixteenth notes beamed together, and two sixteenth notes and an eighth note beamed together. Measure 2 is a dotted quarter note, three eighth notes beamed together, and a quarter note.

Two measures of rhythms in four-four time. Measure one is a dotted eighth note and sixteenth note beamed together, two eighth notes beamed together, an eighth note and two sixteenth notes beamed together, and two sixteenth notes and an eighth note beamed together. Measure two is a dotted quarter note, an eighth note, two eighth notes beamed together, and a quarter note.

content.answer: Two measures of rhythms in four-four time. Measure one is a dotted eighth note and sixteenth note beamed together, two eighth notes beamed together, an eighth note and two sixteenth notes beamed together, and two sixteenth notes and an eighth note beamed together. Measure two is a dotted quarter note, an eighth note, two eighth notes beamed together, and a quarter note.

unit.text: 1: Music Fundamentals I - Pitch, Major Scales and Key Signatures, Rhythm, Meter, and Expressive Elements

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Use symbols and terms to describe features of rhythm in notated music, including meter, note values, and rhythmic patterns and devices.
